website_summaries.verdict: A remarkably comfortable pair of work gloves that are somewhat effective at reducing vibration.
pros: The important difference with DEWALT's gloves is they use a memory foam padding on the palm to both ensure comfort and reduce vibrations
The outer layer is resistant to both oil and water and the ToughTanned leather palm helps provide a firm, non-slip grip
cons: These gloves have so many good things going for them, but the downside is they just aren't made for rugged work as their durability is lacking

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves but don’t cut out vibration
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are well made, well padded and fit very nicely. What they don’t do, however, is cut out vibrations from power tools. Given that that is the whole point of these gloves, have given a 2* rating. If they were some general purpose gloves, they would have been rated higher but I would not have bought them as I was looking for something to reduce power tool vibrations
customer_reviews.author: Brighter

customer_reviews.title: One fits, The Other Too Small
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these a few years ago and wear them hiking to protect my hand with arthritis from the hiking pole's shock. They have worked well for this purpose, but have gotten too dirty and smelly. I agreed to try another pair although I'll be returning these. Will see if the next pair is better. I hope Dewalt quality control of its equipment is better than on its gloves.
customer_reviews.author: LR2

customer_reviews.title: Great protection for your hands.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a job working with pneumatic tools, heavy equipment or driving heavy to over-sized vehicles, these gloves will protect your hands and provide cushion from constant vibrations. Great gloves!!! I'm going to order two more pairs just to be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Maikeru

customer_reviews.title: Lots of hand padding, but fingertips wear out
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought these gloves to do a bit of impact hammering and move concrete debris and rocks, and they worked well for this overall. I have used them for moving firewood and other related items since. They are comfortable to wear. They have lots of padding in the palm area, but I wish the fingertips were thicker/sturdier as they are starting to be exposed now. If the fingertips were improved, I would easily give these 5 stars, but have to take one away for how quickly the fingertips wore out. They were also a bit price compared to other options.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Eddy

customer_reviews.title: Tough gloves
customer_reviews.text: Chainsaw, wood maul, lawn trimmer, brush cutter, weed whacker, leaf blower, tire iron, snow shovel. You get the picture. Best work gloves I've ever owned. I'm 49 and the vibrations from all my tools are minimized thus giving my hands a needed break. They don't shake and ache anymore when I come inside. Two seasons and they're not even close to wearing out. Get 'em!
customer_reviews.author: Michel Richard

customer_reviews.title: Less than 1 day of use failure
customer_reviews.text: Product felt of great quality but after less then a day of work cutting trees down the seams started to come loose. Would not recommend if you are working hard outside with serious machinery.
customer_reviews.author: Jusburnin_dc5

customer_reviews.title: As described...
customer_reviews.text: Really helps when using an orbital or oscillating sander, but don't expect it to eliminate all vibration. It met my requirements. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Stude Jim

customer_reviews.title: Essential for DIY chain sawing
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had known about this sooner. I cut lots of (smallish) trees down for myself and neighbors - very hard on the hands. Then I was told about these. Bought them and makes a world of difference.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado cottonwood

customer_reviews.title: They fill great
customer_reviews.text: I love this gloves I don't feel the vibration from the needle gun
customer_reviews.author: emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: Less tingling in my fingers after using my hammer
customer_reviews.text: I have carpal tunnel in my wrists, and swinging a hammer has become somewhat painful for me, so I decided to try these gloves. They really do help, and I can tell the difference after a day's work. Not sure how well they'll hold up, as I'm trying to use them only for impact/vibration type work because of the cost, but they're certainly worth the investment already.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Milligan

customer_reviews.title: Better than bare hands....
customer_reviews.text: I have a Sears 4-stroke lawn trimmer. Works well, but it's a bit hefty (I use a shoulder strap) and the vibration is sufficient to leave my hands so tingly that I can't play my guitar for a couple of hours after a trimming session. So, I decided to try these. Plus..... They fit well, appear well-made, and the velcro closure is secure. Minus... They are a bit better than no pads, but far from perfect. I just did the lawn this afternoon, and still got the tinglies for about 15 minutes afterwards. Not as severe as without, but hardly optimal.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Werner

customer_reviews.title: These actually work and fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: A bit snug fit. Excellent padding in palm. Does an adequate job of dampening vibration from weedeaternor chainsaw. Only minor complaint is wrist strap could be wider.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vibration not some everything glove
customer_reviews.text: Best vibration gloves I have found. Other so called vibration gloves are more impact than vibration. I wanted to be able to hold onto vibrating equipment without having my hands tingle. These work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: They do reduce the amount of vibration while using power tools. These gloves fit very well. So, I use them for all the gardening I do using a ax, pick or shovel. I highly recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: khaled

customer_reviews.title: Christmas present for my brother
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my brother who works with power tools in his woodworking. He requested these specifically.
customer_reviews.author: mlh_031806160910

customer_reviews.title: Not anti vibration in the slightest
customer_reviews.text: Did not help one bit with vibration numbness. A 45 minute trip with my lawnmower and my hands are as numb as if I had worn nothing. Very disappointed. Would not buy again nor would I recommend it to anybody or accept it as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Horlor

customer_reviews.title: Helps my arthritis
customer_reviews.text: I have nasty arthritis in both thumbs, somewhat less in the wrists and fingers. The vibration from my belt sander and particularly random orbit sander had limited me to about 15 minutes. With the gloves, I'm good for about an hour without pushing it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G. Cain

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit good and protects my hands. But can use thicker padding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt Vibration Reducing Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my husband to reduce the effects of all of the machinery he uses in his line of work. He is pleased with them
customer_reviews.author: Flora E. Haas

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for my son who was doing a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son who was doing a lot of grinding at work. He says the vibration reduction is noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: ackiola

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This gloves are very well made and after a lot of extensive usage with power tools yet they look brand new :)
customer_reviews.author: tecfield

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves; a good investment
customer_reviews.text: I received the item pictured. Great gloves; a good investment!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels good on the hands but haven't used it yet
customer_reviews.text: Feels good on the hands but haven't used it yet. Will update my review once I get to use them.
customer_reviews.author: deshpremi

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. I have to do intense drilling through concrete and this certainly reduces the intensity of the vibrations.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Harris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: exactly what I needed for using a sledge hammer to protect my hands
customer_reviews.author: W. W. Barnhill

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I think these are really good gloves but I chose small from the size drop down menu and received XL, so I can't entirely speak to their quality as they don't fit at all well. Still, they are effective even so large, so I think they are wonderful quality at a reasonable price. The seller also gave me a small courtesy refund for the inconvenience, so kudos to their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri B.

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt DPG250 Large Vibration Reducing Gloves, Large
customer_reviews.text: They seem very good except Large are too tight-fitting. I strongly suggest anyone ordering get the next larger size from their normal size.
customer_reviews.author: Donald McCann

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This inside of the gloves stained my hands black on the first use. Very difficult to remove the stain.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Readnour

customer_reviews.title: DEWALT DPG250 VIBRATION CONTROL GLOVES
customer_reviews.text: THESE GLOVES ARE THE BEST I'VE EVER OWNED. I JUST GOT THEM IN THE MAIL AND SINCE THE WEATHER IS SO COLD OUTSIDE;I HAVEN'T HAD A CHANCE TO USE THEM WITH MY TOOLS. BUT YOU CAN FEEL HOW MUCH BETTER THEY ARE THAN MOST YOU WOULD FIND AT HARDWARE STORES. I HAVEN'T TAKEN THEM OFF SINCE I'VE BEEN HOME;EVEN WHILE TYPING THIS REVIEW. I'LL WRITE ANOTHER PART TO THIS REVIEW TOMORROW ONCE I GET OFF WORK TO HELP COVER MORE DETAIL..
customer_reviews.author: KANE

customer_reviews.title: Great for sledgehammer work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair last year for some sledgehammer work. Swinging a 20pound hammer on steel wedges was causing a lot of tendonitis pain and trigger finger using normal leather work gloves. These helped a lot, much less pain after several conitnuous hours of hammering. Trouble is I wore them out but even with a lot of duct tape, the gloves were still great. They can take a serious beating.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Friscia

product_meta.title: DeWalt DPG250 Large Vibration Reducing Premium Padded Glove, Large
product_meta.description:
Size:One SizeThe DEWALT DPG250 Vibration Reducing Premium Padded Glove is a high oscillation vibration reducing glove that features Tough Tanned leather palm with strategically placed high density memory foam pop outs, making this the “best in field” for mitigating high oscillation vibration when finger dexterity is a must.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The DeWalt DPG250 vibration reducing premium padded glove is a high oscillation vibration reducing item that features ToughTanned leather palm with strategically placed high density memory foam pop outs. These features make the glove the "best in field" for mitigating high oscillation vibration when finger dexterity is a must. Suggested use applications: sanders - routers - grinders - finishers.
feature_bullets: Memory foam palm padding reduces stressful vibrations, increasing power tool control
Premium, Water & Oil Resistant, Tough Tanned Leather Palm provides ultimate grip & durability
Stretch nylon gusset protects from debris
Extended Ulna Lock TPR Wrist Closure for snug, secure fit

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars58 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
